text: If you already have a custom CMS, I think hooking it up with Asana or Airtable APIs might be the move. If you’re looking for something already integrated, I think a tool like Letterdrop, Contently, or Coschedule would be the better choice.

elements.text: If you already have a custom CMS, I think hooking it up with Asana or Airtable APIs might be the move. If you’re looking for something already integrated, I think a tool like Letterdrop, Contently, or Coschedule would be the better choice.

text:
Hey, folks! I need advice on the situation with originality:

Hardly ever do I copy any sentence or phrase from other articles, but the originality score is about 90% before adding keywords and about 85 - after adding them. Tools highlight separate words that seem overused on the web. But, many of the words can’t be changed without losing the meaning.

I am mostly using <https://content-watch.ru/> as a plagiarism checker. Our SEO specialist recommends it.
Advego desktop tool always gives me no more than 90, while SEO told me 95 is OK for the tool.

With some articles, it turned into a nightmare.

What can you advise? Using other tools, blaming long keywords, keep working on my vocabulary, etc?

P.S. I am not a native speaker, but I am expanding my vocabulary and working with the teacher to make my writing more native.

I am mostly using

as a plagiarism checker. Our SEO specialist recommends it.

text: AI-powered writing assistant tools could be helpful for you. I find WordTune, a Google Chrome extension, to be particularly useful for finding new ways to write a sentence.

elements.text: AI-powered writing assistant tools could be helpful for you. I find WordTune, a Google Chrome extension, to be particularly useful for finding new ways to write a sentence.

text:
I think 85% is still pretty decent, for certain topics (especially where you need to use certain terms), it can be tricky to get a high uniqueness score, especially if the content is on the longer side, naturally you may phrase or describe things similarly to how others do when they write about a topic. I used to get very hung up on the uniqueness score to the point where the writing did not sound natural anymore because I was trying to use words that were so different from what others use, but it only ended up making the text more difficult for readers, and it didn't flow as well.

So as long as you're writing original content and writing in a way that makes the content flow nicely, I think you should be good.
